prompt: Photorealistic image of a single, extremely rare vintage Corningware casserole dish (e.g., Black Starburst pattern) presented like a museum artifact. Centered composition within the 16:9 frame, resting on a dark, polished wood surface. Dramatic, focused spotlight from above highlights the pattern and pristine condition. Shallow depth of field blurs the background subtly. Style: High-end product photography, emphasizing value and rarity. --ar 16:9 --style raw
name: value-of-old-corningware-image-1.png

prompt: A comparative diptych layout within a single 16:9 frame. Left side: A common vintage Corningware 'Cornflower Blue' casserole dish, clean but clearly used. Right side: A rare, highly sought-after vintage Corningware 'Floral Bouquet' pattern casserole dish in mint condition. Both are shot from a slightly elevated angle against a clean, neutral grey studio background. Even, bright, diffused lighting across the entire scene. Style: Informative, professional catalog photography. --ar 16:9 --style raw
name: value-of-old-corningware-image-2.png

prompt: Extreme close-up macro photograph focusing on the underside backstamp of a vintage Corningware dish (e.g., 'Corning Ware P-series Made in USA'). The landscape 16:9 frame captures the texture of the Pyroceram material and the details of the embossed or printed mark. A sliver of a gloved hand gently holds the edge of the dish for scale. Lighting is bright and clinical, revealing minute details and condition. Style: Documentary, appraisal focus, hyperrealistic detail. --ar 16:9 --style raw
name: value-of-old-corningware-image-3.png

prompt: A wide-angle, beautifully styled shot of a curated collection of vintage Corningware displayed on open wooden shelves in a bright, airy room. The 16:9 composition showcases a variety of patterns (Cornflower Blue, Spice O' Life, others) and sizes, arranged aesthetically. Natural sunlight streams in from a window on the left, creating soft highlights and shadows. Style: Lifestyle photography, collector's showcase, warm and inviting atmosphere. --ar 16:9 --style raw
name: value-of-old-corningware-image-4.png

prompt: An atmospheric shot inside a well-lit, upscale antique shop, focusing on a valuable vintage Corningware piece (e.g., a Spice O' Life 'La Marjolaine' percolator) prominently displayed on a glass shelf. The 16:9 frame allows for blurred background elements like other antiques and warm store lighting, creating context. A small, elegant price tag is subtly visible near the item. Focus is sharp on the Corningware, soft elsewhere. Style: Environmental portrait, retail context, professional realism. --ar 16:9 --style raw
name: value-of-old-corningware-image-5.png
